title: Any chance with "No block bodies to write in this log period"?  (Fixed by restart)
body:
Our BSC nodes went from having this every other day to going down every 30-60 minutes once we have upgraded erigon from 2.32 to 2.34 today.

Any chance for an update fixing this anytime soon? 

Update: thanks to suggestion by @mandrigin this is fixable by a restart, no need to unwind.
And it happened multiple more times today across our nodes

@revitteth I think its the same that we experienced.

@egorFiNE restart helps, right?
@mandrigin conveniently I have got at least one failed BSC node, so trying now.
@mandrigin indeed it is! A simple restart fixed this issue momentarily.

Yeah, that means it’s the same issue I am having every now and then. If I get it myself, I can try to investigate. Maybe if your node gets stuck, let it be there for 1-2 hours and then do SIGQUIT on it and paste the goroutines trace here.

https://stackoverflow.com/a/35290196

Same issue on my side since many time.

Like @nikolinsko I made a script to restart, but in bash if someone need :

```
#!/bin/bash
set -x
# Define the number of log lines to check
LOG_LINES=50

# Define the number of occurrences before triggering a restart
OCCURRENCES=10

# Continuously check the logs
while true; do
    # Get the last 30 log lines
    LOGS=$(journalctl -u erigon-bsc --lines=$LOG_LINES)

    # Count the number of occurrences of the error message
    COUNT=$(echo "$LOGS" | grep -o "No block headers to write in this log period block number" | wc -l)

    # Check if the error occurred more than 10 times
    if [ $COUNT -gt $OCCURRENCES ]; then
        # Restart the erigon-bsc service
        echo "Error occurred more than $OCCURRENCES times. Restarting service..."
        systemctl restart erigon-bsc
    fi

    # Sleep for 60 seconds before checking the logs again
    sleep 60
done
```

@nikolinsko thank you! I will try to rebase on this commit the next time it fails

Somehow it is running for about 14 hours now with no failures.
nvm, trying 2.35.0 now
Having same on 2.35.0
@fenidik can confirm.
logs could be useful here, with about an hour before it is stuck, and an hour after

[erigon.log](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/10451344/erigon.log)

run params: erigon --http --http.api=engine,eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool,shh

Polygon start params:

```
erigon
      --chain=bor-mainnet
      --datadir=/home/erigon/.bor
      --bor.heimdall=http://heimdall:1317
      --snapshots=true
      --maxpeers=300
      --http.addr=0.0.0.0
      --http.port=8545
      --http.api=net,web3,eth,admin,debug,txpool,engine,rpc,trace
      --ws
      --trace.maxtraces=2000
      --trace.compat
      --metrics
      --metrics.addr=0.0.0.0
      --metrics.port=6061
      --port=30303
      --torrent.download.slots=6
      --torrent.download.rate=100mb
      --http.vhosts=*
      --http.corsdomain=*
      --log.console.verbosity dbug
 ```

Using the latest snapshot bootstrap, heimdall is sync'd.

Tried `v2.3.4`, `v2.3.5` & `v0.0.5` and cannot get passed this without restarting erigon every 5 minutes (yes i've let it go for 4-5 hours a few times). It gets to a point where it is downloading block bodies (Stage 5), and then it eventually stops on a block and then keeps looping until you restart. After restart it downloads a bit of the block bodies (1-5000) and then loops on the stuck block body. Peers are fine.

Here are some log snips: https://gist.github.com/Aderks/7e42c17d1e75e4cc5a57d4faedf73244

Can provide more if needed.
Is there any workaround for this right now? This is really annoying
@Aderks same here, I'm unable to launch polygon node on erigon, it stucks.
Yesterday I had "no block bodies" fail 3 times within about 15 minutes on BSC. I have to give it up at that point.
I'm having this issue every 30 minutes now.

Credit goes to a member of The Graph Discord, Adorid | SGTstake

Added this flag `--bodies.cache=21474836480` and I was able to get passed Stage 5 and things are looking healthy. See if it helps...
@AdminAnticaptcha I was running on 600 peers limit or so and yet there were periods where I was having this issue _every few minutes._
@AdminAnticaptcha nope, I have seen 2.35 released and assumed that all urgent pending issues were fixed in it, so did not try to roll back.

> 



> Added this flag `--bodies.cache=21474836480` and I was able to get passed Stage 5 and things are looking healthy. See if it helps...

It helped me at least bypass 5/16 Bodies. Thanks
Please try using `v2.35.2` it has specific fix for that

And bodies.cache will not be necessary with the new version?

On Fri, 20 Jan 2023 at 08:19, ledgerwatch ***@***.***> wrote:

> Please try using v2.35.2 it has specific fix for that
>

@AlexeyAkhunov I just checked. And in fact it does not only still not work, but also breaks the fix with bodies.cache. So now it's not possible at all to get past this issue.
@koraykoska Would you be able to show full log since restart please?

@AlexeyAkhunov I'm trying to reproduce now with 2.35.2. Although my node on 2.35.1 had no glitches for 12h+ at this time, so I'm not sure if I could reproduce. I will post logs once and if it happens.
Still no glitches.
